title: An R package for Agreement Value Significativity
Cohen's \(\kappa\) — Cohen's kappa
code: # create a confusion matrix conf_matrix <- matrix(1:9, nrow = 3, ncol = 3)  # evaluate Cohen's kappa of `conf_matrix` cohen_kappa(conf_matrix) #> [1] -0.04166667

title: Information Agreement — Information Agreement
text: method computes Information Agreement \(\text{IA}\) confusion matrix.

title: Information Agreement — Information Agreement
code: # create a confusion matrix conf_matrix <- matrix(1:9, nrow = 3, ncol = 3)  # evaluate the Information Agreement of `conf_matrix` IA(conf_matrix) #> [1] 0.005631984

title: Scott's \(\pi\) — Scott's pi
code: # create a confusion matrix conf_matrix <- matrix(1:9, nrow = 3, ncol = 3)  # evaluate Scott's pi of `conf_matrix` scott_pi(conf_matrix) #> [1] -0.05633803

title: Uniformly sampling \(\Delta^{(k-1)}\) — sample_prob_simplex
text: function samples k-dimensional probability simplex \(\Delta^{(k-1)}=\left\{ \langle x_1, \ldots x_k \rangle \\mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}^k\, |\, \sum_{=1}^k x_i = 1\right\}\) using uniform probability distribution.

title: Uniformly sampling \(\Delta^{(k-1)}\) — sample_prob_simplex
text: sample \(\Delta^{(k-1)}\) taken according uniform probability distribution.

title: Uniformly sampling \(\Delta^{(k-1)}\) — sample_prob_simplex
code: # sample the 5-dimensional probability simplex sample_prob_simplex(5) #> [1] 0.09154597 0.26428412 0.03201528 0.52208634 0.09006829  # successive calls may produce different results sample_prob_simplex(5) #> [1] 0.009668262 0.628714326 0.070132429 0.088306865 0.203178119  # setting the random seed before the call guarantee repeatability set.seed(1) sample_prob_simplex(5) #> [1] 0.05830519 0.15783181 0.55531351 0.01952378 0.20902571  set.seed(1) sample_prob_simplex(5) #> [1] 0.05830519 0.15783181 0.55531351 0.01952378 0.20902571

title: The \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) — significativity
text: function evaluates \(\sigma\)-significativity agreement value \(c\) either \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\) \(\mathcal{P}_{n}\) depending call parameters. m natural number, \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\) evaluated. number_of_samples natural number, significativity estimated using Monte Carlo method. Otherwise, computation considers \(n \times n\)-confusion matrices. instead m set NULL, function uses Monte Carlo method estimate \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{P}_{n}\).

title: The \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) — significativity
text: sigma agreement measure. n number rows/columns confusion matrix. m sum confusion matrix elements. set NULL, function estimate \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{P}_{n}\) (default: NULL). number_of_samples number samples used evaluate significativity using Monte Carlo method (default: 10000).

title: The \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) — significativity
text: m natural number, function returns \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{M}_{n,m}\). instead m set NULL, \(\sigma\)-significativity \(c\) \(\mathcal{P}_{n}\).

title: The \(\sigma\)-significativity of \(c\) — significativity
code: # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,5} with 10000 samples significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2, 5) #> [1] 0.569  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,5} with 1000 samples significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2, 5, number_of_samples = 1000) #> [1] 0.569  # exactly compute kappa-significativity of 0.5 in M_{2,5} significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2, 5, number_of_samples = NULL) #> [1] 0.5714286  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in P_{2} with 1000 samples significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2, number_of_samples = 1000) #> [1] 0.892  # evaluate kappa-significativity of 0.5 in P_{2} with 10000 samples significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2) #> [1] 0.8916  # successive calls to Monte Carlo methods may produce different results significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2) #> [1] 0.897  # setting the random seed before the call guarantee repeatability set.seed(1) significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2) #> [1] 0.9012  set.seed(1) significativity(cohen_kappa, 0.5, 2) #> [1] 0.9012
